intro: Cryptantha pterocarya var. cycloptera, commonly known as the cycloptera cryptantha, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
